page.title: 17The Bird Life of Llangybi
page.content: Greenshank,Spotted redshank, Greensandpiper,Curlew and Whimbrel have all occured in varying numbers.In August 1984 a magnificent Osprey was present for two days before continuing its southward migration this Spring a Little ringed plover was a first record for the site Llangybi bottom is well known for its wintering flock of about sixty Bewicks swans which return each year from their arctic tundra breeding grounds,usually in November. Up to eight hundred lapwings and small numbers of golden plover have been recorded.Teal,Mallard and Shoveler often feed on the shallow pools and strikingly plumaged Goosander and Goldeneye dive for fish in the icy river waters.Siskins,Redpolls,small northern finches feed on alder cones Redwings and Fieldfares gather in large flocks in the open fields.
